titleproper.value:
Guide to the Records of the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland
                    <lb/>1895-2015
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MS 3034</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Joseph Ditta

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2018-05-24T13:57-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Records of the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Records of the still-active Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland, a lineage organization open to qualified women who descend from Dutch settlers of New Netherlands circa 1674. The Daughters of Holland Dames' objectives are to perpetuate the memory and promote the virtues of the Dutch settlers by collecting and preserving historical and genealogical documents, encouraging historical research and erecting durable memorials in lasting tribute to the early Dutch settlers. Examples are: stained glass windows to Peter Stuyvesant at St. Markâ€™s Church-in-the-Bowery (1903), and to Henry Hudson at the New-York Historical Society (1908). Includes board minutes, financial records, some correspondence, and ephemera.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

This collection should be cited as 
                <emph render="bold">Records of the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland, MS 3034, The New-York Historical Society</emph>.
Gift of the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland, 2015.

[Adapted from 
                <emph render="italic">Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland, List of Members and Associates with the Constitution and By-Laws, 2014-2015</emph> (box 5, folder 2) and Maria A. Dering, 
                <emph render="italic">Researching Your Dutch Ancestors: A Practical Guide</emph>, compiled for the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland in 2011 (N-YHS call no. 
                <extref ns2:href="https://library.nyu.edu/persistent/lcn/nyu_aleph003612598?institution=NYU&persistent">E184.D9 D4 2011</extref>). For information on the current activities of the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland, visit 
                <extref ns2:href="http://www.hollanddames.org/">www.hollanddames.org</extref>.]

Although the collection includes membership registers and printed lists, it lacks the genealogical material supplied by members of the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland to prove their Dutch ancestry. Those papers remain in custody of the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland (
                <extref ns2:href="http://www.hollanddames.org/">www.hollanddames.org</extref>).

subject.value: Women -- Societies and Clubs - New York (State) -- New York.

corpname.value: Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland. -- Archives

dsc.value:
Series I. Governance 4.25 Linear feet 1895-2015 Scope and Contents

This series includes the foundational documents of the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland: its certificate of incorporation (1895), printed constitutions and by-laws; meeting minutes of its governing board; annual reports mixed with scattered officers' reports; and membership registers.

 Arrangement

Series I is divided into four subseries:

Subseries I.A. Founding documents, 1895-2006 Subseries I.B. Board Meeting minutes, 1895-2013 Subseries I.C. Reports, 1898-2012 Subseries I.D. Membership, 1895-2015

 Subseries I.A. Founding documents 1895-2006 Certificate of Incorporation, Constitution, By-Laws, Members (1-128) [bound volume] 1 1 1895-1909 Certificate of Incorporation 1 2 1895 Incorporation documents [copies] 1 3 1909, 1976 Scope and Contents

Includes a copy of a petition to the New York State Supreme Court (1909) to change the name of the organization from "Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of the State of New York" to "Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland."

Membership applications and instructions 5 7 n.d. Candidates for admission to membership 5 8 1923-1991 Series II. Subject Files 6.0 Linear feet 1892-2013 Scope and Contents

This series pulls together varied documents that were stored in loose files and binders. They include correspondence, ephemera, some photographs, clippings, and general subject files relating to Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland activities, events, interests, projects, and outings. The "officers' files" (bulk, 1992-2012), appear to have been assembled by Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland board members, each of whom kept her own records as part of her duties. These include postal and email correspondence, invitations, ceremonial programs, drafts of board minutes, clippings, photographs, and ephemera, such as an orange handkerchief dated "09.09.09" given to invited guests to wave in celebration of the opening of the New Amsterdam Pavilion in Battery Park by Crown Prince (now King) Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands (see box 7, folder 13). The list of Directresses General in the historical note near the start of this finding aid may assist researchers wishing to interpret the material in the officers' files. A small collection of artifacts--largely medals depicting Queen Wilhelmina of the Netherlands--rounds out the series.

 Arrangement

Series II is divided into five subseries:

Subseries II.A. Meetings, luncheons, receptions, 1900-2013 Subseries II.B. Officers' files, 1919-2012 (bulk, 1992-2012) Subseries II.C. Projects and general topics, 1896-2013 Subseries II.D. Talks & papers delivered before the Society & elsewhere, 1892-2013 Subseries II.E. Artifacts, ca. 1898-1990s

Long Island [now Brooklyn] Historical Society 9 1 n.d. Loockermans, Govert | Documentation of 1664 deed from Peter Stuyvesant to Loockermans, and photo of frame made from Stuyvesant pear tree wood. 9 2 1934 Related Archival Materials

This 1664 deed (in Dutch) issued by Peter Stuyvesant, as Director General of New Netherland, to Govert Loockermans for land at Canarsie (now in Brooklyn), and its accompanying frame, made of wood from the pear tree Stuyvesant planted at what became the northeast corner of Third Avenue and East 13th Street in Manhattan, were given to the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland by Mrs. William E. (Emma Du Puy) Reed (ca. 1871-1962), a descendant of Loockermans, in 1933. The Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland transfered both to the New-York Historical Society in 2015. They are cataloged as Y-AHMC - Stuyvesant deed (oversize small). For a translation of the deed, see box 1, folder 2, Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland minutes of 2 January 1934.

[William the Silent] 9 43 circa 1900 Subseries II.E. Artifacts ca. 1898-1990s Bracelet & medals | Queen Wilhelmina 13 [Oversize] 1 ca. 1898-1925 Scope and Contents

An orange silk or satin jewel box containing objects donated to the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland by Mrs. Alexander Crawford Chenoweth (first Directress General) in 1925:

Miniature silver bracelet (or crown?), a memento from Queen Wilhelmina's wedding, 1901. Medal (white metal) inscribed: "Wilhelmina Koningin der Nederlanden [obverse]"; "Ter Herinnering aan de Kroning Van H. M. Koningin Wilhelmina" [reverse], circa 1898-1925. Medal (brown metal, with pendant loop at top) inscribed: "Wilhelmina Koningen der Ned." [obverse], circa 1898-1925. Medal (brown metal, in a lapel pin mounting) inscribed: "Wilhelmina Koningen der Nederlanden" [obverse], circa 1898-1925. Medal | Queen Wilhelmina 13 [Oversize] 2 1923 Scope and Contents

Bronze medal commemorating the silver jubilee (i.e., 25th anniversary) of the reign of Queen Wilhelmina of the Netherlands, inscribed "Wilhelmina Koningin der Nederlanden" [obverse] and "MDCCCXCVIII [1898] - MDCCCCXXIII [1923]" [reverse]. Donated by Mrs. Joseph F. Simmons, who in 1923 received this medal as the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland delegate to the jubilee.

 Medal | Roosevelt, Theodore 13 [Oversize] 3 1920 Scope and Contents

Bronze medal designed by Anna Vaughn Hyatt Huntington and produced by the Medallic Art Company in 1920. Inscribed "Woman's Roosevelt Memorial Association Service" [obverse] and "Theodore Roosevelt / Born October 27, 1858 / Died January 6, 1919" [reverse]. The New-York Historical Society holds another copy of this medal under INV.3562.

 Ribbon samples 13 [Oversize] 4 1980s-1990s Scope and Contents

Fabric samples for Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland lapel pins.

 Series III. Financial 3.25 Linear feet 1896-2011 Scope and Contents

This series contains treasurer and accountant reports, bank statements and cancelled checks for the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames, Descendants of the Ancient and Honorable Families of New Netherland general and scholarship accounts, investment records, and the Society's IRS 990 form (1987-2007). In later years (1992-2011) the treasurer's reports devolve into informal gatherings of bank statements, receipts, paid bills, and correspondence.

 Arrangement

Series III is divided into four subseries:

Subseries III.A. Treasurer's reports, correspondence, receipts, 1896-2011 Subseries III.B. Financial Statements & tax returns, 1964-2007 Subseries III.C. Banking and Investment records, 1938-2000 Subseries III.D. Miscellaneous financial records, 1898-1995
